title: Turn Meeting Notes into a Clear AI Video
subtitle: Convert messy discussions into short, visual explanations people actually remember
hero_caption: When information is visual, alignment improves and follow-ups reduce.

sections.title: The Core Insight
sections.content: Most meetings fail not because decisions are bad, but because outcomes are poorly communicated. Converting meeting notes into short videos forces clarity, narrative, and shared understanding — something text summaries rarely achieve.

sections.title: Why Video Works Better Than Notes
sections.content: Written summaries assume people will read carefully and interpret correctly. A short video creates a single shared narrative — showing priorities, context, and intent — reducing misalignment and repeated clarifications.

sections.title: Use Case 1: Leadership & Management Teams
sections.content: After leadership meetings, decisions often get diluted as they move down the organization. A 2–3 minute AI-generated video summarizing priorities and rationale helps teams align faster without additional meetings.

sections.title: Use Case 2: Project & Cross-Functional Teams
sections.content: Cross-functional teams struggle with context gaps. Turning meeting notes into a visual walkthrough helps stakeholders quickly understand what changed, why it matters, and what action is expected from them.

sections.title: Use Case 3: Trainers & Facilitators
sections.content: Trainers can convert workshop debrief notes into recap videos that reinforce learning, capture key insights, and extend the life of a session beyond the meeting room.

sections.title: The Notes-to-Video Workflow
items: Collect raw meeting notes, chat logs, or transcripts
Ask AI to extract decisions, themes, and key actions
Convert the summary into a simple story flow (context → decision → next steps)
Describe scenes visually instead of rewriting text
Generate a short AI video using a scene-based video tool

sections.title: Prompt to Convert Notes into Video Scenes
sections.content:
Act as a communication strategist.

From the meeting notes below:
1. Extract the key context
2. List decisions made
3. Identify next actions and owners
4. Convert this into a 4-scene video outline

Scene format:
Scene 1: Context
Scene 2: Key decision
Scene 3: Impact
Scene 4: Next steps

Meeting notes:
<<<PASTE NOTES HERE>>>

sections.title: When Not to Use This
items: Meetings with unresolved or conflicting decisions

sections.title: Try This Once
sections.content: Take last week’s meeting notes. Create a 90-second video explaining only three things: what changed, why it matters, and what happens next. Notice how much clearer the communication feels.
